cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.category: Category 2 (expected to reach major-hurricane strength before landfall)
cyclone.current_location: about 360 miles SSE of Lake Charles, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: turning northwest then north-northwest, tracking toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coastline
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the TX/LA border around Cameron–Lake Charles, LA

weather_observation.under_warning: Tropical Storm Warning & Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS (storm-surge watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX to Mouth of the Mississippi River (storm-surge warning) and east of Intracoastal City, LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River (tropical-storm warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Louisiana coastline, with greatest impacts expected from Intracoastal City westward; eastern Louisiana (including Plaquemines Parish) subject to storm-surge flooding and tropical-storm-force winds
weather_observation.storm_surge_above_3_feet: Likely (forecast 2–4 ft; threshold of 3 ft could be exceeded)
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–55 mph) possible late Wednesday evening through early Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground possible at the mouth of the Mississippi River, with waves on top of surge
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rainfall with localized flooding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes beginning Wednesday evening; dangerous rip currents and rough seas on approaches to the port
